items.sentence: Did you know Tom and Mary are both blind in one eye?
Tom has been stealing money from his mother's purse.
Tom noticed Mary didn't seem to be enjoying herself.
Tom said he hoped he never had to go back to Boston.
Tom and Mary held hands as they walked on the beach.
I thought I'd drop by and see how things were going.
Our raft sprung a leak and we barely made it ashore.
A lot of the people can't read very well, or at all.
Mary likes the new dress that she got for Christmas.
I'm a little hesitant to ask a favor of that person.
Don't you know that everything I have is yours, too?
By the time I got there, the party was already over.
This rain is likely to change to snow later tonight.
When Tom heard what had happened, he got very angry.
Has it ever occurred to you that you might be wrong?
Before long, the ghost disappeared into a thick fog.
There were shepherds keeping watch over their flock.
The point is whether Tom will read my letter or not.
I wonder whether or not Tom knew you had to do that.
Tom said he thought that Mary wasn't good at French.
